item.chiselsandbits2.chisel.help: $ to chisel|$ to place or swap|$ to display menu
item.chiselsandbits2.tape_measure.help: $ on two points to measure spaces|Shift + $ on a block to clear previous measurements|$ to display modes
item.chiselsandbits2.morphing_bit.help: $ to place or swap bits|$ to remove bits|Sneak + click air to lock
item.chiselsandbits2.morphing_bit.help.l: $ to place or swap bits|$ to remove bits|Sneak + click air to unlock
item.chiselsandbits2.bit_bag.help: $ to open|$ to open quick select menu
item.chiselsandbits2.chiseled_block.help: Sneak to place off-grid|$ to open mode options
jei.item.chiselsandbits2.chisel: Use the chisel to sculpt custom blocks, it allows you to modify each pixel individually. Left clicking removes one bit and right clicking places the most recently selected bit. You can select bits using any type of bit storage: a bit bag, a bit beaker or a palette. You can press Left + Alt to open the radial menu to select a mode. Every mode affects which bits are removed by a single click in a different way.
jei.item.chiselsandbits2.bit_bag: Bit Bags are used to store bits and to select which kind of bit should be placed. Pressing Left + Alt opens the quick menu where you can easily select which bit you want to place.
jei.item.chiselsandbits2.tape_measure: The tape measure allows you to plan out future builds by the bit or by the block. Right click the first position and then right click a second position to make a selection between those two points. Left + Alt opens a menu where you can select some options like the colour of the measurement or whether you want to measure by the bit, block or in a line.
jei.item.chiselsandbits2.morphing_bit: A morphing bit can be used to easily view the currently selected bit type. Placing it in the off hand is encouraged. Additionally, the morphing bit mimics the behaviour of the chisel but you need a chisel in your inventory too.
jei.item.chiselsandbits2.wrench: The wrench is a tool with which you can rotate or mirror chiseled blocks. The face of the block you click on is taken into account when rotating or mirroring.
general.chiselsandbits2.info.need_chisel: You need a chisel in your inventory to be able to chisel
general.chiselsandbits2.info.need_bits: You need more bits in your bit containers to be able to chisel
general.chiselsandbits2.info.no_selected: You need to select a type of bit to place before you'll be able to chisel
general.chiselsandbits2.info.wasting_bit: There's no space available to put the bits currently being chiseled
general.chiselsandbits2.info.out_of_rang: You need to get closer to modify this block
general.chiselsandbits2.info.not_rotatab: That block can not be rotated
general.chiselsandbits2.info.not_mirrora: That block can not be mirrored
general.chiselsandbits2.info.unlocked_mb: Unlocked morphing bit; places globally selected bit
general.chiselsandbits2.info.locked_mb: Locked morphing bit; will place currently selected bit
general.chiselsandbits2.info.place_mode: Now in placement mode; bits will be placed next to existing bits
general.chiselsandbits2.info.swap_mode: Now in swap mode; bit targeted will be replaced by placed bit
general.chiselsandbits2.info.drawn_regio: You can't modify that big of an area at once.
general.chiselsandbits2.undo.error_undo: Undo couldn't be performed successfully, block must have changed
general.chiselsandbits2.undo.error_redo: Redo couldn't be performed successfully, block must have changed
general.chiselsandbits2.undo.missing_bit: Your bits ran out whilst performing this action
general.chiselsandbits2.undo.missing_dur: Your chisel broke whilst performing this action
advancements.story.craft_chisel.title: A World of Bits
advancements.story.get_bag.title: Portable Bit Storage
advancements.story.get_bag.description: Craft a bit bag to store bits in
button.chiselsandbits2.trash: Clear bag contents; hold item to filter
button.chiselsandbits2.trash.confirm: Are you sure you want to void all bag contents?
